question: David goes to the store to buy some tea. The normal brand of tea he buys costs €16 per kilogram. He had to buy a more expensive brand that costs 35% more since his favorite brand was sold out. He decides to buy a week's worth of tea and he uses 2 kilogram of tea per day. He also decided to buy himself a muffin for €4. How much did everything cost?
answer:
The tea he bought was 16*0.35=€<<16*0.35=5>>5 more expensive per kilogram than what he normally buys
So it cost 16+5=€<<16+5=21>>21 per kilogram
He goes through 2*7=<<2*7=14>>14 kilograms of tea a week
So he paid 21.6*14=€<<21.6*14=302>>302 on tea
That means his total bill was 302+4=€<<302+4=306>>306
#### 306
